alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 17 at 3:25AM EST until November 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Erie and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and impact Interstate 90. The hazardous conditions will impact this morning`s commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snowfall rates will continue through the predawn hours, with snowfall rates of one to two inches per hour expected within the heaviest pockets of snow. Snow will decrease in intensity as it shifts inland during the day today, before the most organized bands of snow lift north over Lake Erie this evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
